node.title: Royal Commissioner acknowledges potential conflict of interest over friendship with RSL president, who co-owned vineyard with brother
node.alt: A man pours a glass of wine for a couple, with several branded bottles in front of him.
node.description: Royal commissioner James Douglas QC — whose brother once co-owned a vineyard with the president of the RSL — has acknowledged a potential conflict of interest just days out from the start of the royal commission into veteran suicides.
node.content:
["One of the Royal Commissioners examining Australia's high rates of military suicides has acknowledged a potential conflict of interest over his links to the country's largest veterans' group.\u00a0", "Just days before the first public hearings of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide, the ABC has obtained official correspondence detailing commissioner James Douglas QC's \"social connection\" to the RSL's national president and how both men have agreed to cease contact.", "In July, the former Queensland Supreme Court Justice was announced as one of three royal commissioners to investigate the veteran suicide crisis, along with Nick Kaldas and Dr Peggy Brown.\u00a0", "", "
James Douglas QC has agreed not to have contact with the RSL president during the Royal Commission.(Supreme Court Library of Queensland)
", "A letter sent in November by the solicitor assisting the royal commission states that Commissioner Douglas QC will have \"no further contact\" with RSL national president Greg Melick for the duration of the inquiry.", "\"Commissioner Douglas first became acquainted with Mr Melick through Commissioner Douglas's brother [Francis]\u00a0who, like Mr Melick, is a barrister at the NSW Bar.\"", "\"Commissioner Douglas and Mr Melick have been on friendly terms for many years,\" the letter dated November 1 states.", "The correspondence also reveals that Commissioner Douglas's brother, Francis Douglas QC, owned a vineyard with Mr Melick from approximately 2002 to 2008.", "", "
Pressing Matters vineyard in Tasmania was founded\u00a0by RSL president Greg Melick, along with barrister Francis Douglas QC.
", "\"In early July 2021, following his appointment as a royal commissioner, Mr Melick contacted Commissioner Douglas to congratulate him on his appointment,\" the correspondence noted.", "\"We are informed that: (a) Mr Melick and Commissioner Douglas had a brief conversation; [and] (b) Commissioner Douglas asked that they should have no further contact from this point on for the duration of the royal commission; and Mr Melick agreed to this request.", "A spokeswoman for the royal commission said it did not publish details about personal associations, but information on potential organisational conflicts of interest were available on its website.", "\"The royal commission is committed to the integrity of this process and is confident all appropriate declarations have been made and acted upon,\" the spokeswoman said.", "\"This is vital to maintain public confidence in the important work of the commission.\"", "The letter in question from the solicitor assisting the royal commission was sent to veterans' advocate Julie-Ann Finney, whose son, Dave, took his own life after medically discharging from the navy in 2017.", "Since then, the grieving mother has been a vocal critic of the government's reluctance to establish a royal commission\u00a0and, in March,\u00a0the RSL president was forced to apologise to her for private comments questioning her motivations.", "", "
Julie-Ann Finney has spoken out about the impact of losing a loved one through PTSD.(ABC News: Simon Royal)
", "Ms Finney says she is not confident all conflicts of interest have been properly addressed ahead of the royal commission's public hearings, which begin next week.\u00a0", "\"What we need is independence and transparency at a time where I have proven, time and time again, this government has spun me and not told me the truth and attempted to keep up with the cover-ups,\" Ms Finney said.\u00a0", "\"We need to know that we have people [who]\u00a0really want to investigate why our veterans are dead and dying,\" Ms Finney told the ABC."]
